website_summaries.verdict: The Viewsonic TD2220 is a responsive 22-inch touch-screen monitor that delivers bold colors and crisp text. However, its off-angle viewing performance is less than optimal, and it is not Windows 8 certified, though it does work with the OS.

customer_reviews.title: Best touch screen value out there! Works flawlessly with my Surface Pro and Plugable USB 3.0 docking station.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this unit to wall mount in a workstation docking location for a Surface Pro. Unit is connected via DVI, USB and audio to a. Everything fired right up; monitor at native resolution, touch enabled and accurate and audio working with a good bump in volume vs Surface Pro speakers. Pros: - size - colors for main user - touch accuracy - built in speakers - price/value - VESA mount - resolution matches hd laptop resolution - reaching for screen to click a button actually works! Cons - colors yellow for off center viewers - screen glare in high ambient light - DVI only might be an issue for some - no bezel touch ability means some gestures don't work

The clarity and sharpness of this monitor is stunning. Set up could not be easier ... plug it in and windows 8 took over and it works perfectly. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: onlineshopper

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor - but trouble with Windows 8 edge gestures
customer_reviews.text: As a touchscreen monitor this is a great product: great image quality and great value. However, the bezel isn't flush with the screen so the Windows 8 gestures that require you to move in from the side are difficult to accomplish. As you sweep from the bezel, your finger doesn't enter at the exact edge of the screen, so Windows 8 often doesn't recognize the gestures. It's possible to learn to get them to work much of the time: start the gesture by touching the screen right at its edge with your fingernail "pointing in," but I still have trouble with the top and bottom gestures.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Image Quality Touch-Screen Monitor
customer_reviews.text: The ViewSonic TD2421 24 Inch touch-screen monitor produces an excellent image, with nicely saturated colors and crisp detail. I'm using it in a Virtual Organ installation (using Hauptwerk and Grand Orgue) I've designed that displays the organ console's stops, pistons, and couplers, and when you touch the stops they either come on or turn off. However, the only issue with this model is that the screen is very reflective so you'll need to be careful with not placing it in away the reflects too much. Otherwise it's an outstanding 24" monitor and touch-screen combination. This is actually my 2nd (same model).
